1.verse: Keep me safe, my God,

1.verse: I love you, Lord , my strength.

2.verse: The Lord is my rock, my fortress and my deliverer;

3.verse: I called to the Lord , who is worthy of praise,

4.verse: The cords of death entangled me;

5.verse: The cords of the grave coiled around me;

6.verse: In my distress I called to the Lord ;

7.verse: The earth trembled and quaked,

8.verse: Smoke rose from his nostrils;

9.verse: He parted the heavens and came down;

10.verse: He mounted the cherubim and flew;

11.verse: He made darkness his covering, his canopy around him—

12.verse: Out of the brightness of his presence clouds advanced,

13.verse: The Lord thundered from heaven;

14.verse: He shot his arrows and scattered the enemy,

15.verse: The valleys of the sea were exposed

16.verse: He reached down from on high and took hold of me;

17.verse: He rescued me from my powerful enemy,

18.verse: They confronted me in the day of my disaster,

19.verse: He brought me out into a spacious place;

20.verse: The Lord has dealt with me according to my righteousness;

21.verse: For I have kept the ways of the Lord ;

22.verse: All his laws are before me;

26.verse: to the pure you show yourself pure,

43.verse: You have delivered me from the attacks of the people;

10.verse: to him who struck down the firstborn of Egypt

11.verse: and brought Israel out from among them

12.verse: with a mighty hand and outstretched arm;

13.verse: to him who divided the Red Sea asunder

14.verse: and brought Israel through the midst of it,

15.verse: but swept Pharaoh and his army into the Red Sea;

16.verse: to him who led his people through the wilderness;

17.verse: to him who struck down great kings,

18.verse: and killed mighty kings —

19.verse: Sihon king of the Amorites

20.verse: and Og king of Bashan —

21.verse: and gave their land as an inheritance,

22.verse: an inheritance to his servant Israel.

23.verse: He remembered us in our low estate

24.verse: and freed us from our enemies.

25.verse: He gives food to every creature.

26.verse: Give thanks to the God of heaven.

1.verse: By the rivers of Babylon we sat and wept

2.verse: There on the poplars

3.verse: for there our captors asked us for songs,

4.verse: How can we sing the songs of the Lord

5.verse: If I forget you, Jerusalem,

6.verse: May my tongue cling to the roof of my mouth

7.verse: Remember, Lord , what the Edomites did

8.verse: Daughter Babylon, doomed to destruction,

9.verse: Happy is the one who seizes your infants

1.verse: I will praise you, Lord , with all my heart;

2.verse: I will bow down toward your holy temple

3.verse: When I called, you answered me;

4.verse: May all the kings of the earth praise you, Lord ,

5.verse: May they sing of the ways of the Lord ,

6.verse: Though the Lord is exalted, he looks kindly on the lowly;

7.verse: Though I walk in the midst of trouble,

8.verse: The Lord will vindicate me;

1.verse: You have searched me, Lord ,

2.verse: You know when I sit and when I rise;

3.verse: You discern my going out and my lying down;

4.verse: Before a word is on my tongue

5.verse: You hem me in behind and before,

6.verse: Such knowledge is too wonderful for me,

7.verse: Where can I go from your Spirit?

8.verse: If I go up to the heavens, you are there;

9.verse: If I rise on the wings of the dawn,

10.verse: even there your hand will guide me,

11.verse: If I say, “Surely the darkness will hide me

12.verse: even the darkness will not be dark to you;

13.verse: For you created my inmost being;

14.verse: I praise you because I am fearfully and wonderfully made;

15.verse: My frame was not hidden from you

16.verse: Your eyes saw my unformed body;

17.verse: How precious to me are your thoughts, God!

18.verse: Were I to count them,

19.verse: If only you, God, would slay the wicked!

20.verse: They speak of you with evil intent;

21.verse: Do I not hate those who hate you, Lord ,

22.verse: I have nothing but hatred for them;

23.verse: Search me, God, and know my heart;

24.verse: See if there is any offensive way in me,

1.verse: Rescue me, Lord , from evildoers;

2.verse: who devise evil plans in their hearts

3.verse: They make their tongues as sharp as a serpent’s;

4.verse: Keep me safe, Lord , from the hands of the wicked;

5.verse: The arrogant have hidden a snare for me;

6.verse: I say to the Lord , “You are my God.”

7.verse: Sovereign Lord , my strong deliverer,

8.verse: Do not grant the wicked their desires, Lord ;

9.verse: Those who surround me proudly rear their heads;

10.verse: May burning coals fall on them;

11.verse: May slanderers not be established in the land;

12.verse: I know that the Lord secures justice for the poor

13.verse: Surely the righteous will praise your name,

1.verse: I call to you, Lord , come quickly to me;

2.verse: May my prayer be set before you like incense;

3.verse: Set a guard over my mouth, Lord ;

4.verse: Do not let my heart be drawn to what is evil

5.verse: Let a righteous man strike me—that is a kindness;

6.verse: Their rulers will be thrown down from the cliffs,

7.verse: They will say, “As one plows and breaks up the earth,

8.verse: But my eyes are fixed on you, Sovereign Lord ;

9.verse: Keep me safe from the traps set by evildoers,

10.verse: Let the wicked fall into their own nets,

1.verse: I cry aloud to the Lord ;

2.verse: I pour out before him my complaint;

3.verse: When my spirit grows faint within me,

4.verse: Look and see, there is no one at my right hand;

5.verse: I cry to you, Lord ;

6.verse: Listen to my cry,

7.verse: Set me free from my prison,

1.verse: Lord , hear my prayer,

2.verse: Do not bring your servant into judgment,

3.verse: The enemy pursues me,

4.verse: So my spirit grows faint within me;

5.verse: I remember the days of long ago;

6.verse: I spread out my hands to you;

7.verse: Answer me quickly, Lord ;

8.verse: Let the morning bring me word of your unfailing love,

9.verse: Rescue me from my enemies, Lord ,

10.verse: Teach me to do your will,

11.verse: For your name’s sake, Lord , preserve my life;

12.verse: In your unfailing love, silence my enemies;

1.verse: Praise be to the Lord my Rock,

2.verse: He is my loving God and my fortress,

3.verse: Lord , what are human beings that you care for them,

4.verse: They are like a breath;

5.verse: Part your heavens, Lord , and come down;

6.verse: Send forth lightning and scatter the enemy;

7.verse: Reach down your hand from on high;

8.verse: whose mouths are full of lies,

9.verse: I will sing a new song to you, my God;

10.verse: to the One who gives victory to kings,

11.verse: deliver me;

12.verse: Then our sons in their youth

13.verse: Our barns will be filled

14.verse: our oxen will draw heavy loads.

15.verse: Blessed is the people of whom this is true;

1.verse: I will exalt you, my God the King;

2.verse: Every day I will praise you

3.verse: Great is the Lord and most worthy of praise;

4.verse: One generation commends your works to another;

5.verse: They speak of the glorious splendor of your majesty—

6.verse: They tell of the power of your awesome works—

7.verse: They celebrate your abundant goodness

8.verse: The Lord is gracious and compassionate,

9.verse: The Lord is good to all;

10.verse: All your works praise you, Lord ;

11.verse: They tell of the glory of your kingdom

12.verse: so that all people may know of your mighty acts

13.verse: Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom,

14.verse: The Lord upholds all who fall

15.verse: The eyes of all look to you,

16.verse: You open your hand

17.verse: The Lord is righteous in all his ways

18.verse: The Lord is near to all who call on him,

19.verse: He fulfills the desires of those who fear him;

20.verse: The Lord watches over all who love him,

21.verse: My mouth will speak in praise of the Lord .

1.verse: Praise the Lord .

2.verse: I will praise the Lord all my life;

3.verse: Do not put your trust in princes,

4.verse: When their spirit departs, they return to the ground;

5.verse: Blessed are those whose help is the God of Jacob,

6.verse: He is the Maker of heaven and earth,

7.verse: He upholds the cause of the oppressed

8.verse: the Lord gives sight to the blind,

9.verse: The Lord watches over the foreigner

10.verse: The Lord reigns forever,

1.verse: Praise the Lord .

2.verse: The Lord builds up Jerusalem;

3.verse: He heals the brokenhearted

4.verse: He determines the number of the stars

5.verse: Great is our Lord and mighty in power;

6.verse: The Lord sustains the humble

7.verse: Sing to the Lord with grateful praise;

8.verse: He covers the sky with clouds;

9.verse: He provides food for the cattle

10.verse: His pleasure is not in the strength of the horse,

11.verse: the Lord delights in those who fear him,

12.verse: Extol the Lord , Jerusalem;

13.verse: He strengthens the bars of your gates

14.verse: He grants peace to your borders

15.verse: He sends his command to the earth;

16.verse: He spreads the snow like wool

17.verse: He hurls down his hail like pebbles.

18.verse: He sends his word and melts them;

19.verse: He has revealed his word to Jacob,

20.verse: He has done this for no other nation;

1.verse: Praise the Lord .

2.verse: Praise him, all his angels;

3.verse: Praise him, sun and moon;

4.verse: Praise him, you highest heavens

5.verse: Let them praise the name of the Lord ,

6.verse: and he established them for ever and ever—

7.verse: Praise the Lord from the earth,

8.verse: lightning and hail, snow and clouds,

9.verse: you mountains and all hills,

10.verse: wild animals and all cattle,

11.verse: kings of the earth and all nations,

12.verse: young men and women,

13.verse: Let them praise the name of the Lord ,

14.verse: And he has raised up for his people a horn,

1.verse: Praise the Lord .

2.verse: Let Israel rejoice in their Maker;

3.verse: Let them praise his name with dancing

4.verse: For the Lord takes delight in his people;

5.verse: Let his faithful people rejoice in this honor

6.verse: May the praise of God be in their mouths

7.verse: to inflict vengeance on the nations

8.verse: to bind their kings with fetters,

9.verse: to carry out the sentence written against them—

1.verse: Praise the Lord .

2.verse: Praise him for his acts of power;

3.verse: Praise him with the sounding of the trumpet,

4.verse: praise him with timbrel and dancing,

5.verse: praise him with the clash of cymbals,

6.verse: Let everything that has breath praise the Lord .
